column5: Nice RC.  Congrats dood!
Very well done, congratulations! You'll never forget your First deer!
Nice one Chadâ€¦and butchering yourself
Only way to go!!!
We did very well for meat. 25lbs ground and the rest steaked, turned into roasts or cutlets.! Nothing fancy
Let's see a pic of the table fare when you can .Damn I would love to live up in some place like yours.
We did very well for meat. 25lbs ground and the rest steaked, turned into roasts or cutlets.! Nothing fancy  I do lots of stew meat, love venison stew
Oh ya, I did a few stewing pieces as well. I'm really looking forward to some 1" thick deer steaks!  Chris, I have a nice plot at the corner of the road that I'm looking to sever  up to 20 acres.
Congrats Chad!
Good going Chad!  Your daughter is a real cutie!
Chris, I have a nice plot at the corner of the road that I'm looking to sever  up to 20 acres.    I'm worried you would be a noisy neighbor with your gunshots, chainsaws and snowmobiles
They would be only slightly louder than your gunshots, chainsaws and snowmobiles
Epic???
Congrats !!!
Epic  yeah, simple, but hilarious response, classic!
Forget the chainsaws and whatnot a sleepless baby and parents would be a bigger concern.
Congrats!
Big doe. Tagged and almost done butchering myself. Hell yea!!!
Awesome!!!  Congrats!  Looks big too, nice eating!
Right on! Good job bud!
Wait a go, big forsure,  enjoy
That's a big girl!!  Congrats Chad!!  Get them tender loins out, and cook em tonight!!!  By far my favorite part of the harvest!!
Awesome man congrats
Nice big doe, same way I started 40 some years ago. Congrats
Nice deer. Cool to see your daughter in the pic.
That is awesome man!  Well done!  Mark
That'll fill the freezer.
I'm not a hunter,but that is a big gal!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!,congrats!
Congratulation. You should get quite a few meals out of that girl.
Nice, lets year the story of how it all went down.....shotgun? Rifle? How did it happen? Did you have her on your camera?  S.

I played the wind and switched stands to the other side of my property on the second evening. I had never set up a camera here, but the stand faces a tree-heavy steep ridge with apples on top, and tracks were common in the area. Sunset was at 5pm and I used my Grandpas 303 which he had just gifted me. At 520 pm she's within earshot coming up behind me. At 525 I saw her on my far right, light was disappearing fast. I inched the riffle towards her until I could finally get a shot and took it, awkwardly, at 529. 5 seconds later she was down and dead... Perfect heart shot with no meat damage!! Another minute and I was past the legal shooting time.  We removed every square inch of meat off her... Even the meat between the ribs and up the neck. 20lbs of meat is for grinding and the remainder was steaked or made into roasts. We are a happy family!
Nice Chad!  Yeah, some of the details would be interesting.
Oh, and she was different from the ones caught on camera, the 'twins' are still alive as of yesterday. We are now on the hunt for bucks.  ***look up Chris ^
That'll fill the freezer.   Yup.  Nice going  And great story.  CONGRATS

Gramp's old 303...love it. With so much emphasis these days on powerful Short Magnums, I like to see old guns/calibers still in service and taking game. Wonder what kind of stories that gun could tell?
Love the 303!  Great shot!!! Whats the est. Distance?
Way to go man!
That is beautiful big Doe for Your first deer, I assume it was on Your own property which is even  nicer. Congrats Mike
It was a 20-30 yard shot. Not many long range shots available on my property.
Mah boy is firing the 303 tomorrow hopefully. Hes out for his first deer?
Good luck to your boy! Those 303 bullets are getting expensive eh?

And hes only 12, but hes a good shot.  Mine was grandfathered to me as well, you still have the bayonet?  Man I love that gun!  When I was around that age it felt like firing a rocket launcher lol. But mah boy handles it well.  I hope he gets his first deer, thats all hes been talking about!  If he gets skunked oh well. But i think he will get one.
